c:complexType.name: BoxplotChart
c:complexType.c:documentation:
The options documentation class of the Box plot chart.
Default Data Format For general information on the supported data formats see .
The boxplot chart employs a non-default logical row to dimensions mapping:
All of the free columns of the "series" physical group generate and load free dimensions of the "series" dimension group: "series", "series2", ...
All of the free columns of the "categories" physical group generate and load free dimensions of the "category" dimension group: "category", "category2", ...
Free columns of the "measures" physical group generate and load, in order, skipping the dimension when not-free, the following numeric dimensions:
median
lowerQuartil
upperQuartil
minimum
maximum
All the following are possible default layouts and dimension assignments:

c:property.name: medianRole
c:property.c:documentation:
The median visual role is a plot-level visual role that is visually encoded by the position of the middle rule of the box visual element, along the orthogonal axis.
This is a shortcut property for the main plot's .

c:property.name: lowerQuartilRole
c:property.c:documentation:
The lowerQuartil visual role is a plot-level visual role that is visually encoded by the bottom position of the box visual element, along the orthogonal axis.
This is a shortcut property for the main plot's .

c:property.name: upperQuartilRole
c:property.c:documentation:
The upperQuartil visual role is a plot-level visual role that is visually encoded by the top position of the box visual element, along the orthogonal axis.
This is a shortcut property for the main plot's .

c:property.name: minimumRole
c:property.c:documentation:
The minimum visual role is a plot-level visual role that is visually encoded by the position of the rule that crosses the top whisker of the box visual element, along the orthogonal axis.
This is a shortcut property for the main plot's .

c:property.name: maximumRole
c:property.c:documentation:
The maximum visual role is a plot-level visual role that is visually encoded by the position of the rule that crosses the bottom whisker of the box visual element, along the orthogonal axis.
This is a shortcut property for the main plot's .

c:property.name: baseAxis
c:property.c:documentation:
The base cartesian axis panel options.
When the chart is vertical the base axis is laid out horizontally.
See to know the additional names by which a cartesian axis can be referred to.

c:property.name: panelSizeRatio
c:property.c:documentation:
Percentage of occupied space over total space in a discrete axis band.
The default value is 1/3.
See for more information.

c:property.name: box
c:property.c:documentation: The box plot is the main plot of the box plot chart, which means that its properties may be used without the "box" property suffix.

c:property.name: plot2
c:property.c:documentation:
Activates the second plot.
The second plot shows the values of the median role, in the first orthogonal cartesian axis.
It is a generic point plot, which means that its properties , , and
can be set freely.
By default, the second plot shows lines and dots/markers.
By default, the second plot uses the second color axis.

c:property.name: color2Axis
c:property.c:documentation:
The second color axis options.
By default, the second plot uses the second color axis.
See for more information on the way that the color axes' properties may be accessed.

c:complexType.name: BoxplotPlot
c:complexType.c:documentation: The options documentation class of the Box plot.

c:property.name: visualRoles
c:property.c:documentation:
The plot's visual roles map.
See for more information.

c:property.name: stacked
c:property.c:documentation: The box plot only shows a single series of data and, as such, this property is meaningless.

c:property.name: layoutMode
c:property.c:documentation: The placement of boxes within the same category band.

c:property.name: boxSizeRatio
c:property.c:documentation:
The percentage of box space over total space in a category band and with a grouped layout.
Only relevant when there are multiple series and is grouped.
The empty space is uniformly distributed between boxes.
Bands may have space between them, depending on the base axis' .
A number between 0.05 and 1.
The default value is 0.9.

c:property.name: boxSizeMax
c:property.c:documentation:
The maximum width of a box plot bar, in pixel units.
A number not less than 1, possibly infinity.

c:property.name: maxBoxSize
c:property.c:documentation: Use instead. The maximum width of a box plot bar, in pixel units.

c:property.name: valuesVisible
c:property.c:documentation: This plot type does not have value labels.

c:property.name: valuesAnchor
c:property.c:documentation: This plot type does not have value labels.

c:property.name: valuesFont
c:property.c:documentation: This plot type does not have value labels.

c:property.name: valuesMask
c:property.c:documentation: This plot type does not have value labels.

c:property.name: extensionPoints
c:property.c:documentation: The extension points object contains style definitions for the marks of the plot.

c:complexType.name: BoxplotPointPlot
c:complexType.c:documentation: The options documentation class of the point plot used by the box plot when the second plot is active.

c:property.name: stacked
c:property.c:documentation: The point plot of the box plot only shows a single series of data and, as such, this property is meaningless.

c:property.name: trend
c:property.c:documentation: Trends are not supported by this plot type.

c:property.name: dotsVisible
c:property.c:documentation: Indicates if the visual elements show dots/markers in each point's position.

c:property.name: linesVisible
c:property.c:documentation: Indicates if the visual elements are connected with lines.

c:property.name: colorAxis
c:property.c:documentation: The index of the color axis to use for the plot.

c:property.name: orthoAxis
c:property.c:documentation: The index of the orthogonal cartesian axis to use for the plot.

c:complexType.name: BoxplotPlotExtensionPoints
c:complexType.c:documentation:
The extension points of the box plot type.
Plot extension points can be specified:
at the plot level, in the extensionPoints property, without need to prefix the extension point with the plot id or name.
at the plot options level, directly, without need to prefix the extension point with the plot id or name.
if it is an internal plot (main, plot2 or trend), at the chart options level, directly.
To use an extension point you must find its full name, by joining:
plot property name (ex: box)
extension property (ex: panel)
the "_" character
extension sub-property (ex: strokeStyle)
and obtaining, for the examples, the camel-cased name: boxPanel_strokeStyle (see ).
The extension points of the main plot of a chart may be used without the plot property name prefix. In the example, when the box plot is the main plot, the extension point can be written as panel_strokeStyle.

c:property.name: panel
c:property.c:documentation: The extension point of the category panel of the box plot.

c:property.name: ruleWhisker
c:property.c:documentation: The extension point of the top and bottom whiskers of the box plot visual element.

c:property.name: bar
c:property.c:documentation:
The extension point of the box mark.
The box mark is a bar that extends from the orthogonal position of the lowerQuartil to the position of the upperQuartil.

c:property.name: ruleMin
c:property.c:documentation: The extension point of the rule that crosses the bottom whisker of the box plot visual element.

c:property.name: ruleMax
c:property.c:documentation: The extension point of the rule that crosses the top whisker of the box plot visual element.

c:property.name: ruleMedian
c:property.c:documentation: The extension point of the rule that cuts in two the box bar of the box plot visual element.

c:complexType.name: BoxplotPlotVisualRoles
c:complexType.c:documentation: The visual roles options class of the box plot type.

c:property.name: median
c:property.c:documentation:
The median visual role is a plot-level visual role that is visually encoded by the position of the middle rule of the box visual element, along the orthogonal axis.
The median visual role automatically binds to a single numeric dimension whose name has the median prefix.
The median visual role is required.
See for more information on supported data types.

c:property.name: lowerQuartil
c:property.c:documentation:

The lowerQuartil visual role automatically binds to a single numeric dimension whose name has the lowerQuartil prefix.
The lowerQuartil visual role is optional.
See for more information on supported data types.

The upperQuartil visual role is optional.
See for more information on supported data types.

c:property.name: minimum
c:property.c:documentation:
The minimum visual role is a plot-level visual role that is visually encoded by the position of the rule that crosses the top whisker of the box visual element, along the orthogonal axis.
The minimum visual role automatically binds to a single numeric dimension whose name has the minimum prefix.
The minimum visual role is optional.
See for more information on supported data types.

c:property.name: maximum
c:property.c:documentation:
